Desciption: Aerosmith's seminal fourth album, oozing groove and swagger

Album: A Paranormal Evening at the Olympia Paris
Desciption: One of the best live albums you'll hear, Alice and co bring two LPs worth of career spanning hits to life on stage in Paris
Track Listing: A1. Brutal Planet, A2. No More Mister Nice Guy, A3, Under My Wheels, A4. Department of Youth, A5. Pain, A6. Billion Dollar Babies, B1. The World Needs Guts, B2. Woman of Mass Distraction, B3. Poison, B4. Halo of Flies, C1. Feed My Frankenstein, C2. Cold Ethyl, C3. Only Women Bleed, C4. Paranoic Personality, D1. The Ballad of Dwight Fry, D2. Killer/I Love the Dead, D3. I'm Eighteen, D4. School's Out/Another Brick in the Wall Part II

Desciption: The second album since the bands reunion with classic vocalist Joey Belladonna, this slays!
Sweden's finest melodic hard rockers of the new millenium are firing on all cylenders in this high energy show, featuring current Skid Row vocalist Eric Gronwall behind the mic
Track Listing: 1. Point of No Return, 2. A Shot at Redemption, 3. Better Off Alone, 4. 1000 Miles, 5. It's All About Tonight, 6. Inferno, 7. The Wreckoning/Tearing Down the Walls, 8. Mannequin Show, 9. Late Night Lady, 10. In and Out of Trouble, 11. Downtown, 12. Enemy In Me, 13.Emergency, 14. Breaking the Silence, 15. Living on the Run

Desciption: Crowning achievment of funky rockers Extreme
Blistering solo album from the Stryper frontman, featuring guest appearances by Jeff Loomis, Tracii Guns, Joel Hoekstra and more
Track Listing: 1. Better Part of Me, 2. Lay it Down, 3. Forget, Forgive, 4. Now or Never, 5. Ten, 6. Shine, 7. Let it Be Love, 8. Never Alone, 9. When Love is Hated, 10. Ricochet, 11. With You Till The End, 12. Son of Man

Desciption: Cracking follow up to British Steel, this features hits such as 'Desert Plains' and 'Heading Out To The Highway"
The final album featuring the legenday Jake E Lee on the axe, get amongst it!
A classic slab of early 2000s pop punk
Watch those classic Gunners vids without YouTube interupting you with ads!
Classic debut from the US thrashers Toxik, reissued on Green Vinyl
Take a dark, epic journey with masters of European Power metal - Blind Guardian
All the classic hits you know and love are included on this massive 3LP live set on clear vinyl, as well as a couple of new (at the time) songs.
Do you like Helloween?  This is Kai Hansen's long running band that he started after leaving, and in my humbe opinon this is their best album.  Absolutely crusing power metal.
If you're at all a fan of melodic hard rock with an 80s flavour (but new!), then HEAT is the band for you.  This album includes current Skid Row frontman Erik Gronwall on vocals.

In my opinion the best Testament album without Alex Scholnick, this record is often seen as a return to form for the band.  They returned to their traditional thrash sound while retaining some death metal elements from their previous release.

Testament goes Death Metal!  Chuck Billy perfects his growl.  This is a punishing album - classic Testament elements are here but this is the record where they really chose to embrace the extreme stuff.

Accept continued their fine form from their previous release on this one, the second album featuring their rejuvinated lineup with Mark Tornillo on vocals.  If you love classic Restless and Wild era Accept, you will love this.

One of the biggest comback albums of the century, Worship Music saw Joey Bellodonna return to his rightful place behind the mic for Anthrax.  There is nothing not to love on this one, from all out thrash a la Among the Living, to the epic lengthy 'In the End' in tribute to Dio
After the somewhat patchy Endorama, Germany's kings of thrash returned to their roots on this LP, an all out thrash assault to rival the best of their catalogue

The bands second album with vocalist Annette Olzen, this is my personal favourite of theirs.  The songs are memorable and feature all the classic elements of the masters of Symphonic Metal that you know and love

Possibly the highwater mark for the classic lineup featuring Tarja behind the mic, sadly it was also the last record before here departure.  Her voice sounds stunning and the songwriting is extraordinary.
The latest effort by New Jerey's mean green killing machine.  They sure have been on a tear in the last decade and this album is no exception.  Get it here on Aztec Gold vinyl.

Album: The War to End All Wars
Desciption: Sabaton are one of the biggest names to come out of the power metal world in the last 15-20 years, with their remarkable blend of historical narrative and anthemic metal masterpieces, they continue to headline some of the world's biggest metal festivals.  This one focuses on World War 1, and will have you chanting along in no time.
This is the Scorps embracing the pop metal scene of the late 80s, some really fun, big stuff.
After the obligatory average 90s albums, Sodom were back in the early 2000s to their thrashy best.  In my humble opinion this is one of their best ever releases.  Get it on Olive Green vinyl today.
One of the most exciting, unique bands of the new generation, Volbeat continue to gain new fans around the world.  Get it in your ear holes!
A fantasic British melodic hard rock band, and one of the most exciting new bands out of the motherland in the last 20 years.
Track Listing: A1. Where Are You Now? A2. Freak Show, A3 Never Alone, A4. Tomorrow, A5. Queen, A6. Liar, B1. Time to Go, B2. I Don't Know You, B3. While She Sleeps, B4. Ride to Nowhere, B5. Glory Days

Desciption: The pumpkins are back!  Classic members Michael Kiske and Kai Hansen returned for this epic masterpiece from the forefathers of power metal.

It's remarkable how many quality metal bands come out of the small nation of Sweden, and Narnia is a fine example of Swedish power metal.  This is their latest, featuring soaring vocals, searing guitars and thought provoking lyrics.
Track Listing: A1. Rebel, A2. Thief, A3. Hold On, A4. Glory Daze, A5. Descension, B1. Ghost Town, B2. Alive, B3. Modern Day Pharisees, B4. Out of the Silence, B5. Wake Up Call

Desciption: Early versions of Aerosmith classics which would later be re-recorded and released on later albums (most on the debut).  A really interesting look at the bands development, and great they already were in 1971!
Track Listing: A1. Intro - Somebody, A2. Reefer Head Woman, A3. Walkin' the Dog, B1. Movin' Out, B2. Major Barbara, B3. Dream On, B4. Mama Kin

Desciption: Classic early 90s Motorhead on a mean looking picture disc!
Classic ealry 90s Motorhead.  Lemmy and the boys were in fine form on this one
Brilliant Canadian thrash, these guys are seriously underrated, this reissue just came out in May
Track Listing: A1. As The World Burns, A2. Soldiers of Misfortune, A3. In Defiance, A4. Existence Within Eternity, A5. Pawn of Prophecy, B1. Lost Through Time, B2. A Storm In The Silence, B3. Truth (After the Rain)

Desciption: Glam metal but a bit scary.  Get some Lizzy in ya!
These guys recently hit our shores and were bloody brilliant, this is their awesome debut EP
My money is on these guys as the best Metalcore band, this is their crushing comeback album after Tim's release from incarceration.
The masters of Viking Metal!  Brutal riffs, growls and storytelling
You all know these guys by now - the sophmore effort by the lads blending Maori culture with metal.  It has been very well received on the world stage.
Debut album by the traditional metal legends reissued on some beautiful coloured vinyl.

Album: Not the End of the Road (White LP)
Desciption: These guys are a great edgy hard rock band out of Germany, blending 80s sounds with modern sensibilites.  Really cool stuff.
Track Listing: A1. Not the End of the Road, A2. What Goes Up, A3. Only The Dead, A4. Good Life, A5. Yoko Ono, A6. Coming Home, B1.All For a Hallelujah, B2. No One Dies A Virgin, B3. Gone For Good, B4. Defeat It, B5. Voodoo Spell, B6. Scars

Desciption: Latest album by MSG, features everything you know and love about the legendary axeman.  This one features Ronnie Romero fronting the band for a slew of rocking melodic tunes.
Track Listing: A1. Emergency, A2. Under Attack, A3. Calling Baal, A4. A King Has Gone, A5. The Universe, A6. Long Long Road, B1. Wrecking Ball, B2, Yesterday is Dead, B3. London Calling, B4. Sad is the Song, B5. Au Revoir

Desciption: A really interesting newish band out of the UK, combining folk elements with hard rock and metal.  Almost a bit of a stoner rock vibe too at times.  A little bit like Ghost sometimes but if you swapped Satan for Christ.
Track Listing: A1. He Is The Fight, A2. Spirit and Fire, A3. I Am Redeemed, A4. Archangel, A5. Dry Bones, B1. Sonata, B2. I Will Not, B3. Reap The Harvest, B4. The Crown, B5. Ancient of Days

Desciption: This one sees the Purps take on rock n roll classics, rocking them up with their brand of energetic hard rock
The classic (and some may say best) Armored Saint album performed life, post reunion, on silver vinyl.

Desciption: Latest album by the Canadian technical thrashers
Underrated Bay Area thrashers - this is their fantastic latest album
New album by the hilarious comedic hair metal act - Steel Panher on pink vinyl
Track Listing: A1. Never Too Late (To Get Some Pussy Tonight), A2. Friends With Benefits, A3. On Your Instagram, A4. Put My Money Where Your Mouth Is, A5. 1987, A6. Teleporter, B1. Is My Dick Enough, B2. Magical Vagina, B3. All That and More, B4. One Pump Chump, B5. Pornstar, B6. Ain't Dead Yet, B7. Sleeping on the Rollaway

Desciption: The latest offering by Arch Enemy.  If you caught them destroying The Powerstation this year you know how good they are
The classic debut from Christian hard rock/metallers Bride.  This one is raw, unrelenting speed metal with insane wailing vocals - super cool.
The debut album from yet another awesome Swedish heavy metal band.  And look at that artwork!  Cheesy yet great.

Album: Warriors of the Son (w/ 3 Bonus Tracks)

Desciption: A return to their thrashy roots, Deliverance sound in fine form on this one

Desciption: British technical thrash from the early 90s, remastered on blue vinyl.

The epic collaboration between LA Guns' Tracii Guns and Stryper's Michael Sweet.  Surprisingly heavy with a real metal vibe - a bit Sabbathy in parts.  You don't have to worry about any syrupy 80s ballads on this one.

Desciption: Young british melodic hard rockers tearing up the stage on this live album
